title: Common Denominator
text: The first step is to find the least common denominator of two rational expressions.
speech: The first step is to find the least common denominator of two rational expressions.

title: Common Denominator
text: What is the least common denominator?
speech: What is the least common denominator?
pacedSpeech: What is the least common denominator?

title: Common Denominator
text: Since we do not know the value of $$x$$ or $$y$$, the least common multiple of the denominators is their product. So, the LCD is $$\left(x+1\right) \left(y+1\right)$$.
speech: Since we do not know the value of  x  or  y , the least common multiple of the denominators is their product. So, the LCD is  parentheses x plus 1,  times, parentheses y plus 1,  .

or   y

title: Multiplying the First Expression
text: Now we need to multiply both expressions by a factor equal to $$1$$ that makes the denominators equal to the LCD. Starting with the first expression, we can multiply $$\frac{x}{x+1}$$ by a factor to make the denominator $$\left(x+1\right) \left(y+1\right)$$.

title: Multiplying the First Expression
text: The denominator of $$\frac{x}{x+1}$$ multiplied by $$y+1$$ equals $$\left(x+1\right) \left(y+1\right)$$. So, we need to multiply $$\frac{x}{x+1}$$ by $$\frac{y+1}{y+1}$$.

title: Multiplying the First Expression
text: We can keep the denominator as it is, but distribute the $$x$$ into $$y+1$$: $$xy+x$$.

title: Multiplying the Second Expression
text: Next, we need to multiply the second expression by a fraction to make the denominator equal to the LCD. Because the denominator of $$\frac{y}{y+1}$$ needs to by multiplied by $$x+1$$ to become $$\left(z+1\right) \left(y+1\right)$$, we need to $$\frac{y}{y+1}$$ by $$\frac{y+1}{y+1}$$.

title: Multiplying the Second Expression
text: Distribute the $$y$$ into $$x+1$$: $$x y=xy$$ and $$1y=y$$, so the expression reads $$xy+y$$.

title: Subtracting the Expressions
text: Because the expressions now have the same denominator, we can add the numerators to get the sum of the two expressions. We'll leave the denominator as it is, but combine the numerator's like terms.
speech: Because the expressions now have the same denominator, we can add the numerators to get the sum of the two expressions. We'll leave the denominator as it is, but combine the numerator's like terms.

title: Subtracting the Expressions
speech: What is  x y plus x plus x y plus y ?

title: Subtracting the Expressions
text: Combine the like terms: $$xy+xy=2xy;$$ the $$x$$ and $$y$$ stay the same.
speech: Combine the like terms:  x y plus x y is equal to, 2 x y colon  the  x  and  y  stay the same.

title: Final Expression
text: Now we have our final expression: $$\frac{2xy+x+y}{\left(x+1\right) \left(y+1\right)}$$.
